name: Glenveagh National Park
description: Ireland's second-largest national park featuring mountains, lakes, glens and woods. Home to the beautiful Glenveagh Castle.

name: Fanad Lighthouse
description: One of Ireland's most beautiful lighthouses, offering stunning coastal views and guided tours.

name: Doe Castle
description: 16th-century castle situated on a small peninsula, surrounded by water on three sides.

name: Murder Hole Beach
description: Spectacular secluded beach with dramatic cliffs and crystal-clear waters. Access requires a scenic hike.

name: Mount Errigal
description: Donegal's highest peak offering breathtaking 360-degree views. Popular hiking destination.

name: Slieve League Cliffs
description: Among the highest sea cliffs in Europe, offering spectacular views of the Atlantic Ocean.

name: Glebe House & Gallery
description: Former home of artist Derek Hill, now a gallery featuring his collection and beautiful gardens.

name: Ards Forest Park
description: Beautiful forest park with walking trails, beaches, and picnic areas along the coastline.

name: Grianan of Aileach
description: Ancient stone fort dating back to 1700 BC, offering panoramic views of five counties.
